handNote.desc:
The script is described in
378-382 . It might be slightly more ancient than .

decoNote.desc: Full-page multichrome frame composed of geometric elements.

item.q:
ብዕለ፡ ክርስቶስ።
በንዋዩ፡ ሶበ፡ አገበሮ፡ ፍቅረ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ ለመድኃኒተ፡ ነፍሱ፡ ወሥጋሁ። ወድኅረ ኒ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ዘግሑስ። ወሎቱኒ፡ ኢትርስእዎ፡ በጸሎትክሙ፡ ቅድስት። እስመ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ትክል፡ ወታሰልጥ።

item.desc: The note states that the manuscript belongs to the church of .
The names of ,, and are mentioned.
In some places, the names of , and have been substituted at a comparatively recent period.

history.provenance: The manuscript had very probably belonged to a church in the area, from where it was taken by and brought to . It was then looted by the British Napier expedition in 1868.
